content.question: Which of the following best describes why persistent organic pollutants (<math alttext="P O Ps" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mtext>POPs</mtext></mrow></mstyle></math>) are toxic to organisms?

choices.label: They emit gamma radiation, increasing the likelihood of mutations and cancer.
They do not break down easily and can accumulate in the fat tissue of an organism.
They are easily dispersed by wind and water, greatly increasing the affected areas.
They are naturally occurring in the soil and water; therefore, they easily contaminate the food web.

content.answer: They do not break down easily and can accumulate in the fat tissue of an organism.
